tool.name: condition_darkTargets

param.name: year_workspace
param.dialogReference:
Select the folder containing the raw files for the desired year's imagery. For example, selecting the "2010" folder in the "Products" directly will process all the dark targets shapefiles for 2010.

The file geodatabase will be created in the same directory as this selected folder.

The script will iterate through the selected folder, which has been previously organized in a specific file hierarchy. The shapefiles are detected and loaded for subsequent data conditioning and export as feature classes.

tool.summary:
This script imports all the dark targets shapefiles within a selected year that are produced by the target detection process from RADARSAT-2 imagery.

The data is conditioned to merge acquisition swathes together, and deconflicts any overlapping geometries and their attributes.

The data is then exported in a file geodatabase containing a feature class forevery acquisition swathe.The year's worth of data is now ready to be uploaded to the GEM2 master geodatabase(via the Update Master GDB script in the ConditionDarkTargets Python toolbox) for subsequent analysis.
tool.usage: This script is used to convert the dark targets shapefiles into conditioned feature classes that are ready for subsequent analysis. Select the folder which contains the desired year's shapefiles and the process will produce a file geodatabase containing the conditioned data for that year.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This script imports all the dark targets shapefiles within a selected year that are produced by the target detection process from RADARSAT-2 imagery.

The data is conditioned to merge acquisition swathes together, and deconflicts any overlapping geometries and their attributes.

The data is then exported in a file geodatabase containing a feature class forevery acquisition swathe.The year's worth of data is now ready to be uploaded to the GEM2 master geodatabase(via the Update Master GDB script in the ConditionDarkTargets Python toolbox) for subsequent analysis.
